attributes.action: Make single parents and sole carers a protected category in legislation.
attributes.background: Single parents and sole carers face barriers to employment and social participation beyond those of parents and carers in general. In addition, caring responsibilities are not a recognised 'category' in legislation that protects individuals in vulnerable groups from discrimination and hate crimes.
attributes.additional_details:
Protected category status would prevent exclusion from services and employment by providing a legal right to access, which could be used, to ensure employers and service providers put in place extra adaptations for lone-caring responsibilities, which are a greater barrier than simply parenthood or caring with wider support. This would also enable legal redress against hate-speech often directed at lone parents.

http://tinyurl.com/zh6kkoz
https://gingerbread.org.uk/content/658/Employment

attributes.action: UK government to  strongly criticise the human rights violations in Balochistan.
attributes.background: There has been persecution of religious minorities, targeted killings of civilians, ethnic cleansing of shia muslims, hindus, punjabis, zikris and other minorities by frontier corps and inter service intelligence agency.
attributes.additional_details: This has been brought up by the US government as well as by Declan Welsh in the Guardian. Also Marc Tarabella and Brad Adams (exec. Director of Asian arm of Human Rights Watch) have condemned pakistani government of human rights abuses in balochistan and Azad kashmir. These people deserve to live a free life in their own countries rather than flee seeking justice elsewhere. The UK government needs to show its support to humanitarian causes and rights in every corner of the world.

attributes.action: Require proposed Great Reform Bill to give Parliament a veto on terms of BREXIT.
attributes.background: A repeal bill has been proposed to enable BREXIT, as of the date BREXIT takes effect. We propose this bill contain provisions for a Parliamentary vote or referendum approving the terms of BREXIT, and that for the purposes of the Act BREXIT shall not take effect until such approval has been given.
attributes.additional_details: We the people have the undisputed right, per the 2016 referendum to leave the EU. If the terms of leaving are unacceptable, it should neither be disputed that we have the right to change our minds. While it appears the Prime Minister intents to trigger article 50 without Parliamentary consent or knowledge of a likely deal, Parliament and the people can be given a say by the mechanism described above. The Act means the proposed Great Repeal Bill referred to by Mrs May in Conference on 02/10/2016.

attributes.action: Create a standard VED for all vehicles (with a fixed motor/engine) in the UK.
attributes.background: With vehicle excise duty (VED) rising year after year due to emissions, this is unfair and discriminating to large vehicle owners and being detrimental to the haulage industry, especially when hybrid and electric vehicle are exempt from VED. While the road quality in the UK is in decline.
attributes.additional_details: When VED was first introduced 1920 it was original create to help maintain the road structure of the UK up to 1937, due to weight of the vehicle using it. After 1937 it was change to a general tax, then was changed to emissions from 2001. The problem with this is some hybrid/electric vehicle weigh more than fuel vehicles, due to their components (batteries). Creating a greater stress on the road surface then a fuel vehicle. My proposal is to charge £1 for every 10kg the vehicle weighs.

attributes.action: Make March 29th a public holiday to celebrate article 50 and Brexit.
attributes.background: Britain's exit from the European Union is a hugely significant political, social and economic event. It marks the start of a great new chapter in British history. As such, we should celebrate the triggering of article 50 to mark the start of this process.

attributes.action: Keep a maximum university fee of £9,250 after Brexit.
attributes.background: The prices of university are increasing which will mean there will be a higher debts for students.
attributes.additional_details: Full time tuition fee was up to £9,000 in 2016-2017 but increased to £9,250 in 2017-2018.

attributes.action: Famine ridden South Sudan charging aid workers for entry. UK gov must intervene.
attributes.background: In the face of the biggest famine in 6 years, the South Sudanese government has imposed a $10,000 entrance fee on aid workers entering the country. They are trying to profit from the helplessness of the 7.5 million in need of food. We have a moral obligation to call our government to action.
attributes.additional_details:
The international community, which the UK is a part of, needs to put pressure on South Sudan to allow the completely unrestricted flow of aid to those that need it. Indeed, the UK government needs to formally condemn the immoral and corrupt actions of South Sudanese government, which are nothing short of repulsive.


https://www.google.co.uk/amp/foreignpolicy.com/2017/03/09/famine-wracked-south-sudan-now-wants-to-charge-aid-workers-for-help/amp/

attributes.action: Reduce the business rates increase down to a maximum of 10% pa
attributes.background: many small businesses all over the UK are being forced to close and vacate retail premises due to the government increasing business rates by up to 400% - instantly. This will close shops and increase unemployment. Small businesses simply cannot afford to pay such a large increase.

attributes.action: Abolish the Scottish Parliament
attributes.background: The Scottish Parliament is a failed institution. It fails to govern properly. It was not set up to embroil us in referenda on Independence. All devolved services are failing due to lack of governance. I object to Nicola Sturgeon using my vote to remain in Europe as an excuse for Independence.
attributes.additional_details:
The money spent on the Scottish Parliament and the duplicated, devolved departments would be better spent on essential services.
It is simply an unnecessary tier of government.

attributes.action: Reduce NI Contributions for those on PAYE to the level of the self employed
attributes.background: If the self employed are entitled to the same benefits as those paying NI through PAYE the rates should have parity. Government cannot raise NI for the self employed, lowering the rate for those who pay via PAYE is an option.
attributes.additional_details: The chancellor has been forced to drop an increase in NI contributions for the self employed due to manifesto pledges. The manifesto did not preclude lowering the rate for others.

attributes.action: Scottish Referendum question must include guarantees on borders and currency
attributes.background: In order to avoid confusion and uncertainty any future Scottish Referendum question must gurantee that there will be no hard border between Scotland and England and must also name a valid currency which any future independent Scottish Government would have legal permission to use.

attributes.action: Create a new independent body to regulate football referees in England.
attributes.background:
There is a lack of transparency, consistency, and accountability in how referees are managed in the top flight of English football.  The UK Parliament's recent vote of no confidence in the FA highlights the poor governance.

A new non-FA  independent body is required to rectify the poor standards.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.ft.com/content/718fd0e2-ee15-11e6-ba01-119a44939bb6

attributes.action: Make all dental treatment free for the over 60's
attributes.background: Dental treatment is too expensive for the over 60's and those on pensions, most other things for the over 60's are either free or reduced, (Prescriptions, Opticians) but not the dentist this needs to change. Liquidising food to feed someone isn't the way forward in the 21st centaury.

attributes.action: Enable police to automatically seize bicycle when caught red light jumping.
attributes.background: Everyday, thousands of cyclist ignore red traffic lights. Little is done other than to provide small fine or "slap on the wrist", this clearly is not an effective deterrent. Allowing the police to automatic seize an offenders bicycle might make people thick twice.

attributes.action: Strengthen punishments for hate crimes against LGBT and other people.
attributes.background:
LGBT, religious minorities and other people experience hate crimes on a daily basis.
The current system is broken, crimes are not reported because the fear of the perpetrator being let off easily, this needs to change.

We call on her majesty's government to strengthen punishments for hate crime.
attributes.additional_details:
LGBT, religious minorities and other people experience hate crimes on a daily basis.
The current system is broken, crimes are not reported because the fear of the perpetrator being let off easily, this needs to change.

We call on her majesty's government to strengthen punishments for hate crime, and to put an emphasis on eradicating inequality.

Instagram & Twitter: @St__Campagin
Facebook: Stronger Together

attributes.action: To close a gap in the law, disability discrimination - a school place rejected.
attributes.background: The law prevents to make an appeal on disability discrimination case against LA if they fail to secure a place at chosen by parents school. School also cannot be a challenge on this issue. In the result no one is responsible and a disabled child is discriminated when that placement is rejected.
attributes.additional_details: Under Schedule 17 of the Equality Act, 2010 Tribunal Special Educational Needs and Disability only has the power to consider a claim against the responsible body for school and cannot consider a claim against the local authority for the exercise of powers to determine the admission. The decision about child admission is made by local authority only and if the process is not correct parents cannot pursuit claim of disability discrimination against the local authority.

attributes.action: Abolish the drivers insurance instead have a insurance based on the car they own
attributes.background: Most of the countries around the world including Europe calculate insurance based on the car you own. Why in England we need to pay insurance based on the driver? Once car is insured any driver with the legal driving license can drive that car! Isn't is so easy? Please support this petition. Thanks

attributes.action: Make having a creche for in the workplace and uni mandatory and free for kids.
attributes.background: I am a single mother on benefits and I desperately want to work. Im 22 with no qualifications. I have a high school diploma and I have been well educated in private schools I have a lot to offer if I was given a chance. But you utter single mother and people look at you strange when I do everything.
attributes.additional_details: My child is 1 I want to be able to see her all the time while working. I do not want to live off the state I want to get into the music industry and also get a doctorate in psychology. I dont want to miss out on my daughters youth. There should be a creche at unis and places of work. I want to be independent.

attributes.action: Make posing as someone else via online sites illegal (catfishing)
attributes.background: After personally being 'catfished' and reading about so many others, it's about time it was made illegal. It's completely and utterly disgusting that in this day in age people can pose as someone else online, prey on vulnerable people and leave them feeling violated for their own enjoyment.
attributes.additional_details: In 2014, via an online site, I met 'Darren'. Widowed father of a seriously ill daughter, Georgina. 'Darren' and I spoke for 8 months.In fact, you could say, We knew most things about each other.every time we arranged a meeting, something came up his end. Unfortunately,there isn't enough room for me to explain the whole story on this petition. But I'm sure you get the gist.Darren, his sister and best friend, were all Made up characters by a female who clearly preys on the vulnerability of others.

attributes.action: Ensure government treats mental and physical health equally on PIP eligibility.
attributes.background: The Department for Work and Pensions has been told by two court rulings to treat mental and physical health claimants equally by ensuring those with psychological health conditions are eligible for Personal Independence Payment.
attributes.additional_details: Psychological conditions such as anxiety incur additional costs of non NHS funded prescription medication for instance Finasteride which helps individuals attain some personal independence. Government rhetoric has insisted those with mental health conditions are treated equally with physical health conditions. While individuals with physical health conditions receive mobility assistance in the form of Personal Independence Payment, those with mental health conditions do not receive this.

attributes.action: Increase the funding into grassroots football in the UK.
attributes.background: I believe the state of amateur football picthes across the UK is appalling. The amount of injuries sustained to young and old footballers is increasing on these sort of playing fields. In my opinion, by improving pitches it will not only benefit football in general but the entire nation as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: I have sustained injuries on the current playing fields near my house playing for my local side. Furthermore, I know many others who have had similar experiences to myself. I believe that if we had better grass to play on, it would motivate more of the public to get involved in the sport as well as just getting healthier as a nation. By improving grassroots football, we are becoming healthier and more motivated. Football is just the beginning ,we could also improve rugby pitches and many more.

attributes.action: The UK Prime Minister and Parliament must publicly condemn Trump's BBC ban
attributes.background: On 24th February, UK public service broadcaster BBC and several other media outlets were barred from attending an audience with US White House Press Speaker. This happened only hours after President Donald Trump had tweeted that "fake news media" were "the enemy of the American people".
attributes.additional_details: This unprecedented decision is not only an affront to freedom of expression in general, but also an insult to the professional integrity and ethics of the UK public service broadcasting system. The UK PM has invited Trump to pay a state visit in our country, which will be also covered in the news by the very same public organisation that he has now publicly distrusted. The UK PM and Parliament must unequivocally condemn President Trump's BBC ban as well as all his attacks to the media.

attributes.action: Discontinue religious education after Year 9
attributes.background: Learning about religion is a very important part of living in a fair, democratic society. However, the two hours spent weekly on RE could be of greater use for students studying for their GCSE's.
attributes.additional_details: I am a student, and my peers and I strongly believe that having those extra two hours would really help if used for revision, which will allow us to de-stress, and have time to be the children we're supposed to be.

attributes.action: Require autonomous vehicles to display a visible warning beacon when in motion.
attributes.background: As a software engineer with many years' experience, I  think that mixing AVs with conventional traffic on public roads is  highly risky, with potentially serious/fatal consequences for road users. It will require many years of development to perfect the tech in all weathers/conditions.
attributes.additional_details: There have already been several incidents reported in the USA.

attributes.action: Investigate & regulate excessive fees charged by companies that sell tickets
attributes.background: I  would like to see an investigation into the companies that sell tickets for music concerts & sporting events, for charging fees which include: admin fees, postage, fees to print e-tickets at home, & charge credit cards fees. I feel these fees are excessive and in some cases unwarranted
attributes.additional_details: Consumers are held to ransom by these fees and they can add considerable cost to the ticket purchase. Fees are charged per ticket, and it remains unclear how these companies are able to justify the fees, especially fees to print off an e-ticket at home. Clarification is required as to what consumers are paying for.

attributes.action: NHS to be run by each local council rather than a national organisation
attributes.background: The NHS is run as a national organisation which means that money is wasted rather than being spent on the actual needs of hospitals. This would look to change that and instead give the responsibilities of running the local NHS to local councils - looking at the hospital needs, therefore less waste.

attributes.action: Educate KS4 students with functional skills they can use later in life.
attributes.background: In schools students are taught a variety of different things, but something the education system doesn't teach is functional skills. Being 16 I have no idea how to pay tax or take out a mortgage on a house but we get taught how to analyse 18th century literature..
attributes.additional_details: I would like MORE time dedicated in our schooling (once in KS4) to things we can use later in everyday life in exchange for things that only a small percentage of us will use later in life.

attributes.action: Reduce the cost of council tax for single occupancy households
attributes.background: Council tax rates are often calculated on a basic household unit of two occupants. At the moment, single occupancy households are only offered a 25% reduction on full council tax rates.
attributes.additional_details: This discount should be increased to 50%, as single occupants represent half of the number of occupants used to create the standard council tax rate.

attributes.action: Stop the use of snail slime in beauty products.
attributes.background: The producers/companies agitate and scare the snails using shock/salt to get the desired level of secretion. This is harming and torturing the snails for the use of snail slime in beauty products. It is inhumane, and no animal should be treated this way.

attributes.action: Remove religion as a mandatory subject from school and replace with life skills.
attributes.background: At the moment, schools are required to provide religious education. I believe this lesson should be removed and replaced with a requirement to teach life skills.
attributes.additional_details: Whether you believe in religion or not, you have to agree that time is better spent with teachers instructing students on how to do things like first aid, and pay their mortgages. Most lessons are already a waste of time, but let's start with the worst one and replace it with something useful

attributes.action: Do not bring 3,000 refugee children into the UK.
attributes.background: These children are currently in a safe country, their needs should be met by that country.  It sends out the wrong message and encourages unscrupulous economic migrants/refugees to send unaccompanied and vulnerable children to Europe so they can follow after them.

attributes.action: To stop the government removing the subsidy for blood test strips.
attributes.background: I would like to ask the government not to remove the subsidy for blood test strips. Diabetics need very frequent blood testing 5+ times a day. The cost of strips is £70.00 the outcome of stopping this is reduced blood glucose testing and more hospital admissions from hyper or hypo glycemic Diabetes.

attributes.action: GCSE students should study their chosen subject from year 8.
attributes.background: I believe studying a GCSE is incredibly hard from personal experience, I have found that learning and subject for less that 2 years at GCSE isn't very usefully as it's hard to lear alll the content I believe that from year 8 we should start doing GCSE work because it would alllow for more practice.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, students would be benefited from this because their work would actually be at use by the time exams come around. Learning for year 8 would allow year 7 to be a year where you deciede what subjects you want to take at GCSE and with 4 years of learning this would allow students to possibly take on more GCSEs due to the increased learning time.

attributes.action: Enable Young Couples to Rent by Regulating HMO Licenses
attributes.background:
Young professionals are being forced out of Cities such as Oxford and Cambridge to move back in with their parents due to lack of housing caused by HMO regulations.
We need to have the regulations changed so councils cannot go as low as 2 households / 3 people to require an HMO license.
attributes.additional_details:
Many councils have implemented regulations that prevent more than THREE people residing in a dwelling. Even if TWO of those are a renting couple.

While HMOs may have increased the number of rooms to rent, it is equally removing the amount of available properties for young professionals. Our government should be aware and improve these HMO regulations to ensure more availability.
I strongly believe this will help stabilise housing and help hundreds of individuals who are a value to our cities.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Irish unity
attributes.background: with the majority of Northern Ireland voting to remain in the EU and with a new generation now living in peace, it is the right time for the people of Northern Ireland to decide on their long term future democratically and peacefully
attributes.additional_details: It's been 44 years since the last referendum on Irish unity in 1973 and now with a new generation both North and south, with a growing economy in the Republic of Ireland and particularly after the recent Eu referendum with a majority voting in Northern Ireland voting to remain, the time is right to hold a new referendum for the people of Northern Ireland to determine their future peacefully and democratically for the good of all citizens.

attributes.action: Debate in parliament, the reduction in Foreign aid Budget.
attributes.background:
I have extensive experience within The Community Care Environment and am appalled by the parlous state in our Country at the moment.

We deliver foreign aid in billions-some of which is squandered-and we need to address our domestic health problems before we deliver this largesse to abroad.
attributes.additional_details:
Extensive knowledge of Social Care-previous Domiciliary Care provider to Suffolk County Council, and on board of Charities.

Evidence is clearly provided of our Health and Social Care meltdown, by looking in Communities, witnessing at close hand the downward-spiralling standards, to which we are subjecting our population, children, men and women

attributes.action: Make fake news reporting by the media a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
Fake news stories should never make it to broadcast status or be publicised.
All corporate media outlets whether broadcast news or printed should have to verify, validate and publicise their sources for reports or face criminal charges and heavy financial penalties for disseminating fake news.
attributes.additional_details:
Fake news is a scourge and has been for some considerable time.
It creates distrust of information that is supposed to inform the public.
News media outlets are no longer reliable sources of unbiased news, they are in fact attempting to make news and drive public opinion politically in directions favourable to their owners own views.
The aim of the media is apparently to hold governments and others to account, yet no one is holding the media to account for faking news reports.

attributes.action: Grant automatic asylum to any unaccompanied, displaced child seeking help
attributes.background:
Our MP's recently voted by a majority, to reject a plan for Britain to give shelter and asylum to Syrian children who had arrived in Europe unaccompanied. 
It should be compulsory for our government to grant asylum to vulnerable unaccompanied children, wether orphaned or seperated from family.

attributes.action: Give top Government priority to tackle all sexual abuse, especially child abuse
attributes.background:
Child abuse is a national scandal. 

Rape and sexual abuse of any kind should never be tolerated. Far too little is being done

The Government should give the highest priority to this scandal

This petition pleads for all political parties to unite to stamp down on sexual abuse of all forms
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 20 children are abused (NSPCC)

85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year

Nearly half a million adults are sexually assaulted each year

In 2015/16 police recorded 23,851 adults were raped; 5878 children. 

Only 2,689 convictions (7.5%). In 2011/12 15% were convicted. These figures are a scandal.

1 in 5 women aged 16 - 59 has experienced some form of sexual violence

Only around 15% of those who experience sexual violence choose to report to the police

attributes.action: Change the law on pricing of haircuts/colour. Shouldn't matter what sex you are.
attributes.background: Females have been fighting for equal opportunity for decades. I called a hairdresser today to book an appointment for my partner. I asked for a price and got asked if my partner was male or female, I asked why that was important and I was told because for a female it is more expensive.
attributes.additional_details: Females have been fighting for equal opportunities for centuries. Charging females more for a haircut is no different to females getting paid less for doing the same job as a male. There should be gender neutral pricing laws. The pricing for haircuts/colour should be based on the length of the hair, not the sex of the person having their hair done. I called Kula Kuts in Kent and Toni & guy and both these salons informed me that a female having the same haircut or colour as a male would pay more.

attributes.action: op out of paying into the overseas aid budget and put this to tax to  the NHS
attributes.background: I don't want to put my tax to country's that can afford to send rockets into space when in the uk we have  old people on trolleys in hospital's we need to put the overseas budget to the NHS . if you want to pay into the overseas aid you can op in through the tax system
attributes.additional_details: read the press

attributes.action: PARKING TICKETS: Put clear signage & road markings in restricted parking areas.
attributes.background: Council's should display more signs & have road markings identifying restricted/permit parking areas. Currently, they only have to have a sign on the entrance of the road. These signs can be easily missed, then consequently people are being fined up to £70. This is unfair and needs to be changed.
attributes.additional_details: The requirements for Local Authorities to erect 'Permit Holders Only' repeater signs has been removed which anables the local councils to make more money on these permit holders only areas by not informing the public that the area they are parked in is permit only areas. This is purely a money making scheme and nothing else.

attributes.action: To debate the political impartiality of the Speaker of the House of Commons.
attributes.background: The Speaker of the House of Commons is meant to be impartial. Our Parliament successfully functions because of a set of values, rules and processes. Infringing these rules undermines Parliamentary Democracy and the Institution of Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: MPs should consider the Speakers' recently expressed opinion on foreign policy matters, particularly his hostile position to a US Presidential address and his welcoming stance in relation to countries with a history of human rights abuse including China, Singapore, Indonesia and Kuwait. His inconsistent tolerance of applause in the Commons (acceptable at the end of his own speech and not at the end of SNP speeches) should also be considered.

attributes.action: Ban the advertising of Alcohol on UK TV.
attributes.background:
The UK Government are living in the dark ages, they have put a clear ban on all Tobacco products, banning smoking in public places and at work, Banning all TV adverts for Tobacco products.

Alcohol should be banned, there are more kids Drinking in 2017 than there are Smoking.

Alcohol is worse.
attributes.additional_details:
Go to you local street corner and look at the kids and what they are doing PM's.

Most of them are getting pissed only 2 out of 5 will be smoking.

Get a grip on real life and wake up.

attributes.action: Force Councils to fix the roads throughout England
attributes.background: Within the Northwest alone roads are dangerous cars are avoiding pot holes which in turn could result in a possibly fatal accident. Not only only is this unsafe the overall cost could potentially be higher than if the councils hired someone to fix the roads.
attributes.additional_details: Manchester roads have deep visible cracks which could result in a sink hole, Rochdale roads have potholes inches deep, something needs to be done before an accident occurs.

attributes.action: Action by parliament to stop the proliferation of graffiti in towns and cities.
attributes.background: Graffiti on buildings Is endemic throughout the UK. Measures should be place to stop this anti social practice and clean up the mess created. This should involve hefty fines, community service to remove graffiti and imprisonment for repeat offenders.

attributes.action: Revoke requiring military personnel to swear Oath to the Monarchy & God.
attributes.background:
I considered joining the Navy Reserves until I discovered you are required to swear and Oath of Alliegence to the Monarch and God. 
I feel this shouldn't be in place as it can prevent people from wanting to join. An oath to the Monarchy and religious beliefs should not interfere with service.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oath_of_Allegiance_(United_Kingdom)#Armed_forces

attributes.action: Make Holocaust denial illegal in the UK
attributes.background: In a number of European countries Holocaust denial is an illegal practice including Germany, Austria, Belgium and France. To deny the Holocaust is to deny the suffering of millions and minimise the gross wrongs done against Jewish, disabled, homosexual and non-white people in the 1930s/40s.
attributes.additional_details: In Germany the law states: "(3) Whosoever publicly or in a meeting approves of, denies or downplays an act committed under the rule of National Socialism of the kind indicated in section 6 (1) of the Code of International Criminal Law, in a manner capable of disturbing the public peace shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding five years or a fine." This is the type of ruling I believe should be put in place in the UK.

attributes.action: Install adequately bright street-lighting on all stretches of all UK highways.
attributes.background:
Driving on motorways or on any roads during nighttime can be extremely difficult when the roads are not adequately lit up.
This problem is more severe during the winter period when the nights are longer, darker and prone to complicated weather conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
The amount of drivers using the roads of Great Britain is expanding constantly and the issue of desperately required lighting on all stretches of highways during night hours, which affects millions on a daily, or nightly, basis must be urgently addressed.
This urgent matter affects motorways and all grades of well used roads.

attributes.action: Get Patients The Right to Appeal Removal From G.P Surgery
attributes.background:
As it stands G.Ps can have a patient removed from their list simply by requesting this.
They can cite various reasons, aggressive behaviour , breakdown of Doctor Patient relationship.

The Patient has absolutely no right to appeal or even refute allegations made against them.
attributes.additional_details:
If any individual is accused of anything they should have the right to defend themselves.

In less than one year I have been removed twice & both times the reasons given were downright blatant lies.
